titleproper.value: Guide to the Cover Magazine Archive<lb/>ca. 1986-1999<lb/> <num>MSS.245</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-07-06T15:53:40</date>

abstract.value: <emph render="italic">Cover Magazine</emph> was a New York arts monthly publication that existed from the late 80's through the 90's. Its stated mission was to be a comprehensive arts magazine--"to cover all the arts in every issue"--which included eclectic music and literary features alongside coverage of film, sculpture, dance, photography, and other visual arts. Press, promotional material, and advertiser information, including flyers, invitations, advertising rates, venue regulations, and other miscellaneous files from the magazine's publishing life, may be found in the archive.

p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the
following form:<lb/><lb/>
Identification of item,  date (if known); Cover Magazine Archive; MSS 245; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown.

<emph render="italic">Cover Magazine</emph> was a New York arts monthly publication that existed from the late 80's through the 90's. Its stated mission was to be a comprehensive arts magazine--"to cover all the arts in every issue"--which included eclectic music and literary features alongside coverage of film, sculpture, dance, photography, and other visual arts. A strong cadre of arts and culture contributors and editors worked alongside Publisher/Editor Jeffrey Cyphers Wright, including John Yau, Robert C. Morgan, Judd Tully, Anthony Bozza, A.D. Coleman, Timothy Greenfield-Sanders, and many others. <emph render="italic">Cover</emph> regularly hosted events at Webster Hall and other venues throughout New York City. These included live music concerts, artist discussions, arts and fashion shows, literary readings, and other arts-related events.

The collection of materials pertaining to <emph render="italic">Cover Magazine</emph> consists mostly of press, promo, and advertiser information, including flyers, invitations, advetising rates, venue regulations, and other miscellaneous files.
